summary: States and federal Medicaid funds pay managed care plans based on the number of beneficiaries. The managed care plans then pay health care providers for services. But starting in 2016, states could propose ways to steer payments to providers that met certain goals, such as improved timeliness. As of February 2022, Medicaid approved 79 proposals just for payments starting on or after July 1, 2021—totaling...
title: Medicaid: State Directed Payments in Managed Care
